column4: Any suggestions with my wireless issue? I'd been able to connect to wireless fine for months, but suddenly yesterday it started this pattern of trying to reach the network, making both spheres in the panel icon green, continuing to spin like for several seconds, and then finally failing. I've been on an Ethernet cable since then (which works fine btw) and started following https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Wireles
sTroubleShootingGuide, but it seems more geared toward people who haven't gotten their wireless working in the first place.
isn't it a net issue? (Try in winshit/another lappy)
Thanks for your reply. Three other computers in the house have continued being able to connect just fine. Any other tips? (I'm running Jaunty on an Inspiron 1520.)
hmmm
you have native driver or ndiswrapper?
Do you know how I could check that?
did you even install a wireless driver? or it worked OOB?
Did a clean install of Jaunty maybe three weeks ago, and it worked right away. I did not seek out a wireless driver.
hmmm....
things are being weird with wireless in jaunty lately
pastebin the output of lsmod
you there?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/189705/ Sorry for the delay (first time I've used pastebin), and thanks for your help!
i see no wifi driver module loaded
connect from onther machine
Are you saying I should get on IRC from another machine so I can mess with this one?
yes, i'll run some diagnostics with your help, though im no wifi expert
I'm downloading mIRC on a Windows machine now, anything I can do here in the meantime?
pastebin lspci's output
http://paste.ubuntu.com/189712/
checking....
You still there buddy?
ok, i think i got a way to make your bcm work 100%
